intro: Botrys berlandieri, commonly known as the Mexican morning glory, is a flowering plant native to Mexico and parts of Central America. It is characterized by its striking, trumpet-shaped flowers that bloom in shades of purple and pink. The plant produces small, round fruits that contain several seeds. It thrives in warm, sunny environments and is often found in dry, rocky soils. Botrys berlandieri is a member of the Convolvulaceae family, which includes many species of vines and climbing plants.
